fields.description:
Pull requests rebeased off of  the laster master seem to pass so this is probably a flake: [https://travis-ci.org/apache/arrow/jobs/487275065]  

 {{[INFO] Running org.apache.arrow.flight.TestBackPressure
[ERROR] Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 1, Time elapsed: 1.396 s <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.arrow.flight.TestBackPressure

comments.body: The Flight Java tests had been disabled in CI because they are flaky. There is some kind of memory teardown race condition that causes non-deterministic failures
Hit this a couple of times today. It seems to be worse during peak hours of the day suggesting it occurs when systems are under high load
Has failed on me several times in the last week
I tried to replicate locally with various method (lowering timeouts, forcing high system usage) without success. I will disable the test for now.
